title: Subdomain Takeover at http://gameday.websummit.net
content:
As i said in the title i found a subdomain takeover vulnerability on the url http://gameday.websummit.net
The url was trying to find a bucket that didn't exist from a probably forgotten dns entry that was at
<image_0>
So i created a bucket with the specified name and uploaded a poc.
POC in the pictures
For more infos please ask...
steps: Identify a subdomain (e.g., gameday.websummit.net) that points to a non-existent cloud storage bucket or service.
Create a bucket with the same name as the one the subdomain was trying to access and upload a proof-of-concept (POC) file to demonstrate the takeover.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves a subdomain takeover where a DNS entry points to a non-existent cloud storage bucket. An attacker can claim this bucket by creating it with the same name, thereby gaining control over the subdomain and potentially serving malicious content or phishing pages.
reason: The attack is straightforward and involves minimal components: identifying a misconfigured DNS entry and creating a corresponding cloud storage bucket. There are no complex interactions or state manipulations required.

authnz_metadata.reasoning: The reported subdomain takeover vulnerability involves DNS misconfiguration and cloud resource claiming, not authentication/authorization boundary testing. The described methodology focuses on session/resource permutations within application workflows, while subdomain takeovers require infrastructure analysis of DNS records and orphaned cloud resources. There's no user_session or resource_id manipulation involved in this class of vulnerability.
